item.title: Enable Sudoers
item.description: Arch Linux resources website https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Users_and_groups Enable sudoers Notes Settings Open settings. visudo Uncomment the wheel group, this allows all users in the wheel group to run all commands. %wheel ALL=(ALL) ALL Add user Add user to the wheel group, change userName to the user name you require. useradd -m -G wheel -s /bin/bash userName Protect the user account with a password passwd userName Adding a system user useradd -r -s /usr/bin/nologin userName Changing user login names usermod -l userNewName userOldName Changing user’s home dir usermod -d /new/home/dir -m userName Test if sudo works by entering the command sudo whoami If you get something like this (below), then sudo is working for the set account.
